item.description:
“If you want to hike a 4000 footer, but do not want to do a lot of mileage, this is the hike for you. It is strenuous and challenging, but only a six mile loop with fantastic views!”


Due to the high elevation of the trail head, Caps Ridge Trail provides the shortest route and least elevation gain to a high Presidential peak. However, this trail is far from easy as the traverse of the rocky Caps involves some fairly difficult ledge scrambling, and the upper half of the climb is fully exposed to wind and weather. It can be very slippery during wet weather. The views are worth the hike though, and if you like scrambling and a challenge, you will not be disappointed. We will continue over the summit and take a scenic loop around the east and south side of Mt. Jefferson for incredible views of Mt. Adams and Mt. Washington.

 

THE HIKE

Note: This is an advanced hike for experienced hikers, due to steep elevation gain and rocky ledge scrambles.

We will start by meeting at the Caps Ridge Trailhead on Jefferson Notch Rd. We’ll follow the Caps Ridge Trail for 2.5 miles (going straight at the junctions with The Link at 1.1 miles and The Cornice at 2.1 miles) until we reach the summit.

  • Caps Ridge Trailhead (3008')
  • Jct. Caps Ridge Trail/The Link (3800') (1.1 miles)
  • Lower Cap (4422') (1.5 miles)
  • Upper Cap (4830') (1.9 miles)
  • Jct. Caps Ridge Trail/The Cornice (5025') (2.1 miles)
  • Mt. Jefferson summit (5716') (2.5 miles)

At the summit, we will loop to the east and south by following one of three routes (we can decide the route at the summit):

  • 1.5 mile loop - north on the Loop Trail (0.3 miles), right onto the Gulfside Trail - AT (0.7 miles), and then right onto The Cornice (0.5 miles).
  • 1.2 mile loop – east on the Six Husbands Trail (0.3 miles), right onto the Gulfside Trail - AT (0.4 miles), and then right onto The Cornice (0.5 miles).
  • 0.9 mile loop – south on the Loop Trail (0.3 miles), right onto the Gulfside Trail – AT (0.1 miles), and then right onto The Cornice (0.5 miles).

At the junction of the Caps Ridge Trail and The Cornice, we will turn left and follow the Caps Ridge Trail for 2.1 miles to the Caps Ridge Trailhead on Jefferson Notch Rd.

Distance: approx. 5.5 to 6.1 miles (depending on the summit loop)
Elevation Gain (total): approx. 2700 ft
Exposure: Full @ the summit
Difficulty: Advanced/Strenuous
Pace: Slow/Moderate
Approx. Hike Time (including stops): 6:00+ hrs


WEATHER, TRAILS, and OTHER INFORMATION

http://trailsnh.com/conditions-map.php?find=Mt+Jefferson

http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/Mt-Jefferson

http://www.hikenewengland.com/Jefferson070903.html

 

EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST

Note: Although it is summer, be prepared for changes in temperature and strong winds on the summit. Have layers available; bring plenty of water and food.

NO JEANS, NO SNEAKERS, NO COTTON CLOTHING

Summer Essentials (required):

  • Synthetic Quick-drying Pants or Shorts
  • Synthetic Quick-drying Shirt
  • Sturdy Hiking Boots
  • Synthetic/Wool Socks
  • Rain Jacket with Hood (No Ponchos)
  • Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellant
  • Extra Pair of Socks
  • Rain Shell
  • Water (3+ liters)
  • Headlamp
  • Spare Lithium Batteries for Headlamp. Bring Lithium, not Alkaline Batteries.
  • Map/Compass/Whistle
  • Lunch
  • Snack/Energy Food (extra food)

Remaining Essentials:

  • Medications/First Aid Supplies
  • Emergency Blanket
  • Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
  • Repair Kit/Knife
  • Insulated/Fleece Jacket
  • Extra Layers

Optional:

  • Light-weight Wind Jacket
  • Trekking Poles
  • Light-weight Emergency Shelter
  • Camera/Binoculars

 

DIRECTIONS

Find your way to Route 302, NH.

Heading East on Route 302:

  • Turn left onto Base Road (the road that leads to the Cog Railroad, near Bretton Woods ski area). The turn is about 4.4 miles east of the junction of Routes 3 and 302.
  • Travel about 4.5 miles then, at a crossroads, turn left onto Jefferson Notch Road.
  • Follow Jefferson Notch Road for 3.4 miles and the Caps Ridge Trailhead and parking area will be on the right.

Heading West on Route 302:

  • Turn right onto Mount Clinton Road which is 0.2 mile past the AMC Highland Center.
  • Travel 3.6 miles then, at a crossroads, go straight onto Jefferson Notch Road.
  • Follow Jefferson Notch Road for 3.4 miles and the Caps Ridge Trailhead and parking area will be on the right.

Trailhead Fee: $3 parking fee per vehicle so please have the correct amount.

From Providence: 4 hours
From Newport: 4 hours 30 minutes

Google Maps:
http://maps.google.com/maps?...

Lat: 44° 17' 48.94" (44.296928); Lon: -71° 21' 15.36 (-71.354268)

 

CARPOOL

Use the comments section to arrange carpools.
